intro: Sida lepidota, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Sida lepidota is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
